data.description:
Wizard provides a complete development environment for Arbitrum Stylus smart contracts. From writing code to deploying contracts, every step is streamlined and accessible directly in your browser instead of complex +30 min local setup.

**Demo:** https://x.com/arbitrum/status/1889010128562933845
**App:** https://docs.thewizard.app/getting-started/introduction.html
**Docs:** https://docs.thewizard.app/getting-started/introduction.html

--

# âœ¨ Features

- **Zero Setup Required** - Start building Stylus smart contracts instantly
- **Professional Editor** - Full syntax highlighting with Stylus SDK integration
- **Instant Compilation** - Compile Rust to Stylus bytecode in seconds
- **Built-in Deployment** - Deploy to Arbitrum Sepolia with pre-funded wallet
- **Interactive Testing** - Test contracts through auto-generated interface
- **Code Sharing** - Share contracts via public links

--

# ðŸ’« Wizard vs Traditional Setup

**Initial Setup:**
- **Traditional Setup:** Requires over 30 minutes of installation and configuration.
- **Wizard:** Less than 30 secondsâ€”simply open your browser.

**Prerequisites:**
- **Traditional Setup:** Needs Rust toolchain, Docker, VS Code, and Foundry.
- **Wizard:** Only requires a modern web browser.

**Development:**
- **Traditional Setup:** Local machine setup involving multiple tools.
- **Wizard:** Fully browser-based IDE with no local setup required.

**Compilation:**
- **Traditional Setup:** Involves configuring a local WASM toolchain.
- **Wizard:** Offers instant cloud-based compilation.

**Deployment:**
- **Traditional Setup:** Manual wallet and network configuration.
- **Wizard:** Simple one-click deployment using a pre-funded wallet.

**Testing:**
- **Traditional Setup:** Setting up local test environments manually.
- **Wizard:** Automatically generates ABIs with an interactive testing interface.

**Updates:**
- **Traditional Setup:** Requires manual updates of the toolchain.
- **Wizard:** Platform stays continuously updated automatically.

**Collaboration:**
- **Traditional Setup:** Complex to share development environments.
- **Wizard:** Instant, easy sharing of contracts via public links.

questions.query: How does your project reduce development barriers, improve efficiency, or enhance the security of Web3 projects? Please provide specific examples or metrics if available.

questions.query: Describe the current usage and support for your tool within the developer community. This could include GitHub stars, downloads, or testimonials from developers.
questions.explanation:
Wizard is heavily acclaimed app by the Arbitrum community, you can see last month's stats below.

- **175+ Stylus projects/contracts** successfully created using Wizard.
- **Over 60,000 views** on Wizard-related posts **on X**, receiving recognition and promotion from influential ecosystem members, including the official Arbitrum account.
- A steadily growing user base, with **over 60 active registered developers**.

questions.query: Outline your project's roadmap and how the grant funds will be used to achieve your development goals.
questions.explanation:
## Project Roadmap and Grant Utilization

The grant funds will accelerate the growth of Wizard by developing new features, improving infrastructure, and building a vibrant developer community.

---

### 1. Infrastructure & Enhanced Wizard Functionality

- **"Try on Wizard" iframe buttons**  
  Instant embedding and external integrations directly into websites.

- **GitHub OAuth Integration**  
  Seamless user authentication and collaborative project management.

- **GitHub Project Cloning**  
  Directly clone Stylus projects from GitHub URLs into Wizard IDE.

- **Real-time Event Viewer**  
  Immediate display of contract-emitted events following transactions.

- **Browser-based File Explorer**  
  Intuitive project structure management directly within the IDE.

- **Integrated In-browser Terminal**  
  Manual execution of advanced `cargo stylus` commands for greater flexibility.

- **In-browser Rust Dependency Manager**  
  Easy integration and management of external Rust crates (`crates.io`).

- **Automatic Rust Formatting & Linting**  
  Built-in Rust formatting (`rustfmt`) and linting (`Clippy`) to enhance code quality.

---

### 2. Multi-chain Deployment & Developer-friendly Integrations

- **Simplified Multi-chain Deployment Interface**  
  Direct support for Arbitrum One, Sepolia, and custom Orbit chains through custom RPC endpoints.

- **WASM Binary Analysis and Optimization**  
  Built-in integrations (`wasm-opt`, `twiggy`) offering binary size analysis and optimization suggestions.

- **Secure Wallet Integration**  
  Deployment directly through popular Ethereum wallets for improved security.

- **Automated Contract Verification**  
  Immediate automatic verification of contracts on Arbiscan, eliminating manual processes.

- **Expanded Contract Template Library**  
  A comprehensive collection of pre-built templates, including NFTs, governance mechanisms, and foundational DeFi scenarios.

- **Deployment History Dashboard**  
  Tools to track, manage, and review past deployments easily.

- **Compiled File Downloads**  
  Quick download options for WASM binaries and ABI files to support frontend integrations and external applications.

---

### 3. Community Growth & Educational Content

- **Comprehensive Documentation**  
  Detailed documentation to simplify onboarding and improve developer experience.

- **Tutorial Series**  
  Five written tutorials and three instructional videos focused on practical use cases and key Wizard features.

- **Live Developer Workshops**  
  Two interactive workshops highlighting the capabilities and advanced features of Wizard v2.

- **Community Growth Goals**  
  Achieve measurable community milestones:
  - 150+ deployed contracts
  - 200+ active developers regularly using Wizard
  - 1000+ followers on Wizardâ€™s social media ("@WizardOnStylus")

---

questions.query: For any project deploying smart contracts on blockchain networks, please list all your deployer addresses and their corresponding blockchain networks. Use this format for each entry: [deployer_address], [chain_id]â€”for example, 0x123abc..., 42161 (This represents a deployer address on the Arbitrum network). Please include a separate line for each unique deployer address and blockchain combination.
